items.content_html:
This PR removes the align-tracks CSS property from BCD. Per the data guidelines, this feature can be considered irrelevant and may be removed from BCD accordingly. Even if the current data suggests that the feature is supported, lack of support has been confirmed by the mdn-bcd-collector project (v10.10.9).

Tests Used: https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/css/properties/align-tracks

Additional Notes: This had only been supported in Firefox behind a flag, and the Chrome bug has not progressed.
items.title: Remove align-tracks CSS property from BCD

items.content_html:
This PR updates and corrects version values for Microsoft Edge for the forced-color-adjust CSS property. The data comes from the mdn-bcd-collector project (v10.10.9).

Check out the collector's guide on how to review this PR.

Tests Used: https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/css/properties/forced-color-adjust
items.title: Update Edge data for forced-color-adjust CSS property

Tests Used: https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/css/properties/caption-side
items.title: Update Safari data for caption-side CSS property

items.content_html:
This PR updates and corrects version values for Firefox and Firefox Android for the import.service_worker_support member of the statements JavaScript feature. This fixes #23554, which contains the supporting evidence for this change.

Additional Notes: It is worth noting that this feature, and a subfeature of ServiceWorker indicating ECMAScript module support, were both added in #19835. It has been confirmed that ECMAScript modules aren't supported in Service Workers in Firefox yet.
items.title: Update Firefox data for javascript.statements.import.service_worker_support

items.content_html:
Summary

Update in support of Bug 1475831 WebExtension: content scripts should be injected in data URL pages

Related issues

MDN content changes in TBC
items.title: Support for match_origin_as_fallback in content_scripts manifest key

items.content_html:
Summary

The definition for tabs.updated() uses a notation which is not used anywhere else in BCD (to my knowledge). The notation is not documented in https://github.com/mdn/browser-compat-data/blob/main/docs/data-guidelines/index.md#parameters-and-parameter-object-features

This PR changes the entry for tabs.update() to use the suggested <paramName>_<propName>_parameter notation.
items.title: Replace propName_value notation by paramName_propName_parameter notation in `tabs.update()`

items.content_html:
Summary

The properties of the details parameter of action.setIcon() are currently specified with mixed notations. The suggested notation for such properties is <paramName>_<propName>_parameter.

The windowId property is specified as details_windowId_parameter, while imageData is specified as a flat entry. This is inconsistent.

This PR updates the definition for imageData to match the (suggested) notation used by windowId.
items.title: Fix mixed notations for parameter properties of `action.setIcon()`

items.content_html:
Summary

BCD in support of Bug 1736575 Support execution world MAIN in scripting.executeScript() and content_scripts including:

  • support for MAIN in scripting.ExecutionWorld
  • addition of scripting.ExecutionWorld and the world property to contentScripts.register()

Related issues

Related content changes are in mdn/content#34466
items.title: support-for-execution-world-MAIN

items.content_html:
Summary

Added auto keyword value to outline-color property. It replaced invert keyword.

Test results and supporting details

Checked in the following browsers

  • safari 17.0
  • firefox 127
  • chrome 126

Related issues

It was updated in mdn content but compatibility table does not show auto is not supported anywhere
mdn/content#29798
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/outline-color#browser_compatibility
items.title: Add outline-color: auto keyword

items.content_html:
Summary

Adds browser compatibility data for the declarativeNetRequest type MAX_NUMBER_OF_DISABLED_STATIC_RULES addressing the devâ€“doc-needed request from Bug 1896628[DNR] Enforce a limit to the maximum number of static rules disabled individually.

Version information for Chrome and Safari based on comments on Declarative Net Request proposal: disable individual static rules #162 and the Chrome documentation.

Related content change in PR TBC
items.title: Adds MAX_NUMBER_OF_DISABLED_STATIC_RULES

items.content_html:
Summary

The Gamepad API "trigger-rumble" haptic effect has been supported since Chrome 126 (see the ChromeStatus entry).

This PR adds BCD for related features:

  • "trigger-rumble" as an effect type that can be used in the GampadHapticActuator.effects property.
  • "trigger-rumble" as an effect type that can be used in the GampadHapticActuator.playEffect() method.
  • leftTrigger and rightTrigger as params that can be used in the GampadHapticActuator.playEffect() method.

Test results and supporting details

Related issues
items.title: Add BCD for Gamepad features related to trigger-rumble haptic effect
